case.title: WYSIWYG
case.description: [wysiwyg]. Displays the WYSIWYG tab of the HTML Editor.

case.title: Source
case.description: [source]. Displays the Source tab of the HTML Editor.

case.title: Interactive
case.description: Displays the Interactive tab of the Xbasic Code Editor.

case.title: Show Tags
case.description: Hides and displays symbols in the WYSIWYG tab that indicate the locations of HTML codes and Xbasic code strings embedded within <%a5 ... %> tags.

case.title: Show Borders
case.description: Hides and displays table cell borders.

case.title: Code Library
case.description: [code]. Hides and displays the Code Library toolbar.

case.title: Toolbars
case.description: Hides and displays the following toolbars.
Standard - commonly used file and editing functions
Forms - functions that insert various HTML form elements
Tables - commonly used table editing functions

case.title: Trace Window
case.description: Opens the Trace dialog, which allows you to record object events.

case.title: OLE Automation Browser
case.description: Displays the OLE Automation Object Browser.

case.title: Status Bar
case.description: Hides and displays the Status Bar.

case.title: Window Bar
case.description: Hides and displays the Window Bar.

section.title: Using the Code Library
section.description: To insert code from your Code Library :

step.description: Display the Source tab of your HTML Editor window.
Position the cursor at the code insertion point.
Click [code] to display the Code Library dialog box.
Select the library from the list box at top.
Scroll down to the library entry you want to use and double-click.
